data.title: Naming difference in "scores.mix" file versions (music.yaml update)
data.body:
Depending of which scores.mix file is used (the DL mirror one including the Aftermath expansion tracks or the vanilla one from "Install from CD"-option)
the naming of the file is slightly different. This results in missing out this song when using the bigger scores.mix file with the bonus tracks, since OpenRA can't find the file "await_r.aud", because in the expansion mix files, it is actually called "await.aud".

data.title: Limit of 2 MCV's max in Red Alert.
data.body:
Having a fun game and then, you know that guy, that guy decides "Im just gonna build me a bunch of artirs/V2's and keep them save with base defenses!" and ruins all of the fun.

I leave a game at the first sign of basewalking because its just not fun for anyone involved.

data.title: Weather-Overlay when a match ended
data.body:
I noticed an issue when the match is over and you are scrolling the screen.

I blocked the all update functions of the particles, to stop it from falling down. Like planes are also stopping in midair, but I blocked to much.

That part what moves the particles when you move the screen need to be always active!

data.title: A sub-option for the debug checkbox Build Everything
data.body:
Couldn't the debug option "Build Everything" have a "sub-option" (a checkbox placed bellow) ?
Unchecked, this checkbox would allow to build everything (but restricting the units/buildings to the current player's faction). Checked, the checkbox would allow to build everything (all factions).

![screenshot002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/11484428/3c790856-97ae-11e5-95db-049692c077b1.jpg)

data.title: AI units "give up"
data.body:
I observed this in a mission ("06b: Bridge over the River VizchGoi") after having taken over the enemy base. The enemy tanks positioned on the bridge didn't start attacking even though I got really close with my units. Is this intended behavior?

data.title: Graphics quality setting
data.body: I propose a new `bool Game.Settings.Graphics.CosmeticEffects` which switches optional effects such as trails, decorational sprite overlays and palette rotations on and off. For traits like `WithIdleOverlay` there needs to be a new setting in TraitInfo like `bool PurelyDecorational` which decides if this is optional or has to be rendered. The might not have much effect on (rendering) performance, but in sum should add up. The original Tiberian Sun and Red Alert 2 had a slider named "Visual Details" as well.

data.title: Rewrite line renderer: Part 1 (improved lasers plus other cleanups)
data.body:
This introduces a new line renderer and uses it for:
- Widgets
- A\* / warhead debug overlays
- Range / detection circles
- Laser projectiles

Future PRs will work to remove the old line renderer completely, but this is already large enough and provides several benefits:
- Fixes #7729
- Fixes rendering of wide lines (like the TS disruptor) on some hardware (see discussion in #9357)
- We don't need to flush the renderer when changing line widths, so rendering range circles should in theory be more efficient
- Removes legacy QuadRenderer
- Implements a "flat beam" for use by the disruptor and sonic tank:

![screen shot 2015-11-29 at 13 44 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/11460680/d0584ed6-96e8-11e5-8502-2c4bfb8afc70.png)

data.title: Invalid Operation Exception
data.body:
I was playing a skirmish in the Tiberian Dawn mod, and it exited with a Fatal Error dialog box.

When I looked at the exception log, I saw this:

Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version release-20150919
on map 23f00dd4242754487f7f67d9198549c6a204a5ed (Rogue States by Psydev).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (mtnk 372 (not in world))
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor)
   at OpenRA.Actor.Trait[T]()
   at OpenRA.Widgets.WorldInteractionControllerWidget.<HandleKeyPress>m__1(Actor a)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1.UnionWith(IEnumerable`1 other)
   at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.WorldInteractionControllerWidget.HandleKeyPress(KeyInput e)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleKeyPressOuter(KeyInput e)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.HandleKeyPress(KeyInput e)
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.<OnKeyInput>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.OnKeyInput(KeyInput input)
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2Input.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler)
   at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2GraphicsDevice.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.EndFrame(IInputHandler inputHandler)
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

If any other information is required, please let me know.

data.title: Set missile default acceleration to 0 (prep only)
data.body:
Needed to remake, this patch specifically targets the prep branch only. Previous discussion on #10142.

As discussed on IRC and proven out in #10129. We have to make another ticket regardless for `Next+1` to fix this properly in bleed. This is probably the least-invasive band-aid opposed to setting yaml values.

data.title: Implement a utility command to check for explicit interface implementation violations.
data.body:
cc @OpenRA/engine-hackers

`[PR: Help wanted]` is because I don't know how to add this as a required-passing step to Travis.

It would be of great help if all PRs now and forthcoming implemented their interfaces explicitly, at least until the above-noted Travis step is completed and we can check for it in each PR.

I could add this to `make check` but that is already incredibly slow.
Would that be the proper place to run this?

Currently this produces:

``` bash
tmba:openra thill\ $ orautil all --check-explicit-interfaces

Actor.OnScriptBind (from IScriptNotifyBind) is not explicit!
AsyncAction.Tick (from IEffect) is not explicit!
AsyncAction.Render (from IEffect) is not explicit!
DelayedAction.Tick (from IEffect) is not explicit!
DelayedAction.Render (from IEffect) is not explicit!
FlashTarget.Tick (from IEffect) is not explicit!
FlashTarget.Render (from IEffect) is not explicit!
SpriteEffect.Tick (from IEffect) is not explicit!
SpriteEffect.Render (from IEffect) is not explicit!
BagFile.GetContent (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BagFile.Exists (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BagFile.Write (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BagFile.Priority (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BagFile.Name (from IFolder) is not explicit!
[...snip...]
WithPermanentInjury.SequencePrefix (from IRenderInfantrySequenceModifier) is not explicit!
WithPermanentInjury.Damaged (from INotifyDamage) is not explicit!
WithVoxelUnloadBody.SelectionSize (from IAutoSelectionSize) is not explicit!
WithVoxelWalkerBody.Tick (from ITick) is not explicit!
WithVoxelWalkerBody.SelectionSize (from IAutoSelectionSize) is not explicit!
WithVoxelWaterBody.SelectionSize (from IAutoSelectionSize) is not explicit!
TSShroudPalette.PaletteNames (from IProvidesAssetBrowserPalettes) is not explicit!
TSShroudPalette.LoadPalettes (from ILoadsPalettes) is not explicit!
ImportLegacyTilesetCommand.ValidateArguments (from IUtilityCommand) is not explicit!
ImportLegacyTilesetCommand.Run (from IUtilityCommand) is not explicit!
ImportLegacyTilesetCommand.Name (from IUtilityCommand) is not explicit!

Explicit interface violations: 1983
```

To be less ambiguous I could add method params to the output but this gets ugly when generic types/params are introduced.

**Edit**:
This _still_ doesn't actually work:

``` bash
tmba:openra thill\ $ orautil all --check-explicit-interfaces | head

BigFile.GetContent (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BigFile.Exists (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BigFile.Write (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BigFile.Priority (from IFolder) is not explicit!
BigFile.Name (from IFolder) is not explicit!
D2kSoundResources.GetContent (from IFolder) is not explicit!
D2kSoundResources.Exists (from IFolder) is not explicit!
D2kSoundResources.Write (from IFolder) is not explicit!
D2kSoundResources.Priority (from IFolder) is not explicit!
D2kSoundResources.Name (from IFolder) is not explicit!

tmba:openra thill\ $ make
make: Nothing to be done for 'default'.
```

``` diff
@@ -135,13 +135,13 @@ public Stream GetContent(uint hash)
                        return null;
                }

-               public Stream GetContent(string filename)
+               Stream IFolder.GetContent(string filename)
                {
                        var hash = FindMatchingHash(filename);
                        return hash.HasValue ? GetContent(hash.Value) : null;
                }

-               public bool Exists(string filename)
+               bool IFolder.Exists(string filename)
                {
                        return FindMatchingHash(filename).HasValue;
                }
```

``` csharp
    public interface IFolder : IDisposable
    {
        Stream GetContent(string filename);
        bool Exists(string filename);
        IEnumerable<uint> ClassicHashes();
        IEnumerable<uint> CrcHashes();
        IEnumerable<string> AllFileNames();
        void Write(Dictionary<string, byte[]> contents);
        int Priority { get; }
        string Name { get; }
    }
```

I don't know why the code still sees IFolder as implicit in the above example/diff.

data.title: Set default missile acceleration to 0
data.body: As discussed on IRC and proven out in #10129. If merged, we should make a ticket for `next+1` on the topic of re-adding acceleration, since we're short on time.

data.title: Fix actors not going back to idle animation after custom animation
data.body:
Before this fix, actors which had an idle animation (not an overlay, but a looping `idle` sequence with more than 1 frame) as well as an `active` animation of some kind would get stuck at the last frame of the active animation once it played, because the latter was basically never cancelled.
A few cases have already been fixed in the past (`WithBuildingPlacedAnimation`, `WithAttackAnimation`), but not all of them.

This has gone unnoticed because there are only very few actors in the shipping mods with more than 1 idle frame (RA airfields are the only case I can think of), while TS uses overlays.

data.title: Add actor categories to the map editor
data.body:
Some kind of flag to set a category in the map editor. This would be very useful to organise faction buildings, civilian buildings and rocks & trees, vehicles, infantry etc etc. The lack of organisation becomes a lot more evident in TS and of course RA2, which has hundreds of civilian buildings.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28677282-add-actor-categories-to-the-map-editor?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add choice of tumbnail sizes in map editor
data.body:
These thumbnails become far too big to be practical IMO, especially of course when the tiles/actors get bigger graphics. It would be great if there was a size option that fit them into the menu better.

Something like below, that sets all the thumbails to be the same size and fits them into a nice grid. Options of 'zoom' level on these would please more people too, with an option like 'fit' that does the current method of scaling to fit.

![menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8225171/11452725/0158c178-95ea-11e5-8f6f-587babaf0b13.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28676907-add-choice-of-tumbnail-sizes-in-map-editor?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: D2k missile visual polish
data.body:
Release 20150919 and earlier had the Missile Tank's and Rocket Turret's missiles do a nice arc, which looked pretty nice.
The big D2k overhaul changed the projectile type from `Bullet` to `Missile`, making them fly in a straight line. While they also fly in a straight (kinda) line in the original, the actor artwork suggests they would be fired upwards, and I personally think it looks better with the arc.

data.body:
Add a load map / new map option in esc menu in the editor. Very tiresome that you have to quit from the editor, go back into extras -> map editor just to load or create another map.

data.title: Hotkeys to swap selected tile in editor
data.body:
As an example: up and down arrows to change category, left and right to move between tiles. This would GREATLY speed up mapping.

This could of course be further expanded with other hoykeys, but this seems like the first and most important one to me as it is very slow to manually find your tile every time.

Other potential hotkeys:
- Copy and paste.
- Tile/Overlay/Actors menu swapping.
- Save map.
- Zoom.

data.title: Try to polish the upgrade rules
data.body:
I'd like to get this into prep, as it makes the upgrade from `release-20150919` to the next one easier
(or at least it should).

I'm not offended if this PR is completely ignored in order to focus on more important things, though.

data.title: Added a benchmark mode
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8673.

If you start the game with ~~`Debug.Benchmark=true`~~  `Launch.Benchmark=true` this adds two new files into the Log folder:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/11451951/fff827a0-95d6-11e5-98af-82192b4d4d3f.png)

which record CPU and rendering performance over time in character separated values with `;` as separator to avoid confusion with localized floating point separators. 

You can create graphs, calculate average FPS like values or maybe even do live data analysis with tools like https://kst-plot.kde.org/ This shouldn't limit anyone's freedom.

The Red Alert desert shellmap is a good performance benchmark in itself, but you probably get the most reproducible results by starting a replay directly either from the command line or by double clicking on it.

data.title: Annoying the actors?
data.body:
Is there a way for putting in voices for when you click on an actor multiple times, that they may say something else besides when being selected normally? Some games they say things that show they're annoyed and is usually a fun gimmick.

A sort of throwback easter egg from games like Warcraft 2 when you did it many, many times to a neutral actor (ie: an animal), the unit would unexpectedly blow up and die.
